Present Illness.Main Symptoms: Tremors primarily in right hand, difficulty initiating movement, bradykinesia, postural instability; symptoms have progressively worsened
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Chronic constipation, intermittent anosmia, fragmented sleep with vivid dreams, incidences of dizziness, anxiety, and depression
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: Evaluated by primary care doctor 3 months ago, prescribed carbidopa/levodopa with some symptom improvement, referred to neurology for further evaluation
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Decreased mental sharpness, poor sleep quality, normal appetite, inconsistent bowel movements, slight weight loss (approx. 4 lbs over 6 months)

Systematic Examination.Limbs: Tremor noted in right hand; mild rigidity in limbs; bradykinesia with reduced dexterity
Systematic Examination.Nervous System: Impaired rapid alternating movements; normal reflexes; slightly decreased gag reflex

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Bradykinesia, resting tremor in right hand, cogwheel rigidity, and postural instability
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: MRI of brain: Mild atrophy of the substantia nigra; DAT scan: Decreased uptake in the putamen suggesting Parkinsonism
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Presentation of motor symptoms (tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity), positive response to dopaminergic medication, MRI, and DAT scan findings
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Parkinson's Plus Syndromes (no significant atypical features), Essential Tremor (absence of postural tremor only), Depression (no significant rigidity or resting tremor)

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Presented with right hand tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, postural instability. Positive FH of hypertension. Diagnosis of Parkinson's Disease made. Initiation of physical therapy, occupational therapy, and continuation of carbidopa/levodopa.
Daily Course Records: 21st June: Slight improvement in tremor control, no significant side effects from medication.
22nd June: Continues to respond to treatment, ongoing physiotherapy for mobility.
23rd June: Patient reported improved sleep, mild constipation remains.
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Reviewed case, confirmed diagnosis and management plan, recommended DBS consideration in future.
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Handover to evening shift undertaken, no new issues to report.
Post-Admission Course Records.Stage Summary: Patient stable, responding to treatment. Plan for outpatient follow-up with neurology.
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Consulted with dietitian for management of constipation.
Post-Admission Course Records.Discharge Records: Discharged on 24th June with instructions on medication adherence, follow-up appointments scheduled.

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: Carbidopa/Levodopa 25/100 mg PO TID, Physiotherapy daily, Occupational therapy as per schedule
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: Stool softener PRN for constipation, Sleep hygiene education, Dietary modifications

Hospitalization Record.Temperature Chart: 20th June: Temp: 98.6°F, Pulse: 76 bpm, Resp: 16 bpm, BP: 120/80 mmHg; 21st June: Temp: 98.4°F, Pulse: 78 bpm, Resp: 17 bpm, BP: 118/76 mmHg; 22nd June: Temp: 98.5°F, Pulse: 77 bpm, Resp: 16 bpm, BP: 119/78 mmHg

Diseases of the Nervous System.Name: Parkinson's Disease
Diseases of the Nervous System.Symptoms: Motor symptoms: tremors, rigidity of limbs, slow movement, instability in posture; Non-motor symptoms: presence of constipation, olfactory disorders, sleep disorders, autonomic dysfunction, and mental and cognitive impairments
Diseases of the Nervous System.Differential Diagnosis: Parkinson's Plus Syndromes that occur with other neurodegenerative diseases (overall less frequent occurrence of resting tremor), Essential Tremor (postural/action tremor as the only manifestation), Depression (lack of facial expression, monotonous speech, without rigidity and tremor)

qa_summary.question: According to the hospitalization records of Southport General Hospital, summarize the present illness of K. Mendoza.
qa_summary.answer: K. Mendoza's present illness began 6 months ago with a gradual onset at home. His main symptoms include tremors primarily in the right hand, difficulty initiating movement, bradykinesia, and postural instability, which have progressively worsened. Accompanying symptoms include chronic constipation, intermittent anosmia, fragmented sleep with vivid dreams, dizziness, anxiety, and depression. He was evaluated by a primary care doctor 3 months ago, prescribed carbidopa/levodopa with some symptom improvement, and referred to neurology for further evaluation. His general condition changes include decreased mental sharpness, poor sleep quality, normal appetite, inconsistent bowel movements, and slight weight loss (approx. 4 lbs over 6 months).
ref: Onset: 6 months ago, at home, gradual onset with no identifiable trigger
Main Symptoms: Tremors primarily in right hand, difficulty initiating movement, bradykinesia, postural instability; symptoms have progressively worsened
Accompanying Symptoms: Chronic constipation, intermittent anosmia, fragmented sleep with vivid dreams, incidences of dizziness, anxiety, and depression
Diagnosis and Treatment History: Evaluated by primary care doctor 3 months ago, prescribed carbidopa/levodopa with some symptom improvement, referred to neurology for further evaluation
General Condition Changes: Decreased mental sharpness, poor sleep quality, normal appetite, inconsistent bowel movements, slight weight loss (approx. 4 lbs over 6 months)
